item.title: The next big trend could be fragrances that help with weight loss
item.description: When the perfume Prends-Moi was introduced in the UK in 2012, there was a waiting list of 6,000 people. Its marketing as a “slimming fragrance” is unusual, attributing this property to “betaphroline,” a plant-derived ingredient. Veld’s, the maker of Prends-Moi, suggests that a simple sniff can help curb snacking. Research firm TechNavio, in a report on the French fragrance market, highlighted the potential of slimming fragrances to boost demand. Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of TechNavio, stated that a fragrance company had introduced a slimming fragrance in France designed for weight loss.

item.title: The first product on Unified Inbox's roadmap, Outbox Pro, has been launched
item.description: Source: Unified Inbox website. Unified Inbox, a company specializing in unified communications as a service, recently launched its first product: Outbox Pro, a cloud-based platform. Outbox Pro simplifies and accelerates the process of creating and distributing posts across various social media platforms. This web browser extension, currently compatible with Chrome, empowers users to generate, share, review, modify, approve, schedule, publish, and monitor both original and curated online content. Multiple authors can collaborate on this content, which can be shared across Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

item.title: Encouraging an open workplace culture: the role of leaders
item.description: Open communication and strong relationships are essential for a thriving workplace. UK-based sales and marketing firm Forrest Bell emphasizes that openness involves respectful and constructive dialogue about needs, opinions, and concerns. It also means actively listening to and considering new ideas, questions, and feedback. Forrest Bell believes that a culture of openness fosters trust and facilitates collaboration on projects. It also promotes transparency and streamlines processes in dynamic business environments.

item.title: SingPass has simplified the 2FA verification process before the July deadline
item.description: Singapore’s Infocomm Development Authority (IDA) announced that users of the national digital identity system, SingPass, can now enable two-factor authentication (2FA) more easily. This security feature is mandatory for accessing certain online services. Without activating 2FA, users will lose access to important government e-services like tax filing with the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) and viewing Central Provident Fund (CPF) statements. Starting July 5, 2016, over 100 government e-services will require 2FA.

item.title: Intuit Singapore is set to release a popular expense management application
item.description: Intuit, a leading provider of accounting software for small businesses worldwide, is getting ready to introduce QuickBooks Self-Employed in Singapore. This software helps users efficiently monitor their business expenditures. Launched in the US back in 2015, QuickBooks Self-Employed has gained significant traction, boasting a global customer base of 180,000, a considerable increase from 50,000 just a year ago, including users in Australia. The QuickBooks Self-Employed mobile app, expected to be released later this month, aims to support the expanding freelance workforce.

item.title: Brand Alliance reveals the top influential brands in Asia for 2015
item.description: Source: Brand Alliance. The brand gallery at Marina Bay Sands is open until August 21st. Brand Alliance, using its brand leadership platform Influential Brands, has announced the 2015 Asia’s Top Influential Brands. This announcement leverages consumer insights gathered from 2013 to 2015. This year, the Asia’s Top Influential Brands awards expanded to include over 100 categories. These categories span various sectors, ranging from food and beverage (F&B) and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) to financial services and property development.

item.title: BHM Asia introduces a new booking platform for its X2 and Away villa brands in Chiang Mai
item.description: Source: www.VillasChiangMai.com BHMAsia, a hospitality management and development firm operating in the Asia-Pacific region, has recently launched VillasChiangMai.com. This new website showcases all of their villa rentals available in Chiang Mai, under both their X2 and Away brands. BHMAsia highlights that their Chiang Mai villas offer more space compared to a typical hotel room, featuring distinct bedrooms and common areas. Some villas can even accommodate groups of up to 14 people.

item.title: Finding good people is still a challenge, according to ManpowerGroup
item.description: Source: ManpowerGroup infographic. Around the world, the most difficult positions to fill are in skilled trades (particularly chefs, bakers, butchers, mechanics, and electricians), sales, engineering (mechanical, electrical, and civil), technician roles, and drivers (especially heavy vehicle operators), according to workforce experts ManpowerGroup. The situation in Singapore is somewhat different. While engineers are among the top five hardest roles to fill, as elsewhere, the other four are accounting and finance professionals, sales representatives, secretaries (including receptionists and administrative assistants), and marketing, public relations, and communications specialists.

item.title: Workers value recognition more than money
item.description: Source: ACCA report. Tone at the top influences corporate behaviour the most, according to 61% of respondents. A recent report by the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) titled “Culture and channelling corporate behaviour: ACCA member survey” found that workplace recognition is the most significant motivator for employees across all ages, industries, and locations. Notably, this recognition even outweighs monetary rewards. The survey, conducted with support from the Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC), gathered insights from nearly 2,000 ACCA finance professionals globally.

item.title: A new worldwide network of mobile social influencers has been introduced
item.description: VOLTU, a new performance-based social influencer network focused on mobile acquisition, has been officially launched by mobile advertising technology pioneer Glispa Global Group. Building on Glispa’s successful history of creating custom influencer campaigns for clients like Square Enix and Youzu, VOLTU connects advertisers with global content creators to increase app installs, brand awareness, and user engagement. Influencer marketing is a proven method for engaging consumers because it utilizes genuine and relatable content made by consumers for consumers.

item.title: Etihad, TCA Abu Dhabi, and Miral collaborate to showcase Abu Dhabi as a preferred destination
item.description: Etihad Airways has partnered with the Abu Dhabi Tourism & Culture Authority (TCA Abu Dhabi) and Miral Asset Management (Miral) to enhance Abu Dhabi’s standing as a top global destination for tourism, business, and culture. This collaboration will see the three entities working together to attract more visitors and stopover travelers to Abu Dhabi. Joint efforts will include marketing and communication initiatives, sharing market insights and data, developing loyalty programs, and organizing business and leisure events both within the Emirate and internationally.

item.title: Singapore is known for having one of the most competitive talent markets in Asia
item.description: Source: Randstad Sourceright website. Global figures. Randstad Sourceright, a global staffing agency, has released its 2016 Talent Trends Report, a guide highlighting 30 significant trends influencing talent, employees, and businesses this year. The report incorporates insights from almost 400 HR, talent, and business leaders representing over 60 countries. Randstad Sourceright identified the lack of essential skills and its subsequent impact on businesses, leadership, and succession planning as the most significant talent management challenge today.

item.title: LBS and Fudan have collaborated to introduce a new Global Masters in Management program with a double business degree
item.description: London Business School (LBS) and Fudan University’s School of Management (FDSM) have partnered to create a dual-degree Global Masters in Management (MiM) program. Sir Andrew Likierman, Dean of London Business School, emphasized the increasing need for skilled professionals who can navigate the business landscape in both Eastern and Western contexts. He highlighted that this collaboration reflects their dedication to close partnerships with Chinese corporations. The program aims to equip graduates with a global perspective through direct engagement with both China and the West.

item.title: 80% of Singaporeans living abroad are interested in returning to work in their home country
item.description: A new report from Robert Walters, a professional recruitment firm, suggests that competition for skilled workers in Singapore will increase in 2016. This demand will likely lead to more attempts to recruit Singaporeans working abroad. Hiring managers believe that these experienced professionals could help alleviate the tight labor market, benefiting both companies and the “Fair Consideration Framework,” which promotes local hiring. Returning Singaporeans are desirable candidates because they often have international experience and a broader range of skills compared to their counterparts who haven’t worked overseas.

item.title: For the initial six months, HP Touchpoint Manager is being offered at a discounted rate
item.description: HP has introduced HP Touchpoint Manager, a cloud-based IT management solution specifically designed for small and mid-sized businesses (SMBs). Managing IT systems has become more challenging due to the increasing variety of devices and operating systems used in business, from company-provided equipment to personal devices. HP Touchpoint Manager simplifies IT management for SMBs, helping them ensure device functionality, data security, and IT staff effectiveness. Its adaptability allows it to manage a wide array of devices and operating systems, including iOS, Android, and Windows.

item.title: Prepaid Business Calling Controls Phone Expense
item.description: Your business phone costs are becoming unmanageable, especially in today’s economic climate. While unlimited calling might have been acceptable in the past, now it’s crucial to minimize expenses. This year, prioritize controlling calling habits and securing the most cost-effective rates for both domestic and international calls. TEL3Business offers tools to manage your business calls, whether from landlines or mobile phones. Their strategy combines technology with competitive rates, empowering managers to optimize their telephone budgets.

item.title: Companies are focusing on ensuring that their workforces are prepared for the future
item.description: - The Asia-Pacific region is seeing a high demand for professionals with a mix of skills, especially those with expertise in technology and the ability to adapt to new situations. This trend is driven by the increasing adoption of digital technologies across various sectors. - To attract and keep skilled workers, companies are refining their hiring strategies to identify individuals who are not only experts in their fields but also adaptable and possess a global perspective.

item.title: A white paper providing solutions for talent management in the Chinese hospitality industry
item.description: Florida International University’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management (CSHTM) and its Institute for Hospitality & Tourism Education & Research (IHTER) have published a new resource for HR professionals and hospitality businesses, particularly those working with Chinese markets. The white paper, titled “Managing Growing Pains of China’s Relentless Hotel Development Pipeline,” examines the significant lack of qualified talent within China’s rapidly expanding hotel industry. The paper offers practical solutions such as professional development programs, conflict resolution strategies, and clearly defined career paths to attract and retain skilled employees.

item.title: Grab for Work assists businesses in managing transportation costs
item.description: Grab, a Southeast Asian ride-hailing company, has introduced Grab for Work, a complimentary transport expense management tool for businesses in Southeast Asia. Designed for business leaders, managers, HR, and finance professionals in both SMEs and MNCs, Grab for Work provides a streamlined approach to handling company transportation costs. Developed with feedback from over 150 companies in the region during its beta phase, Grab for Work is currently utilized by a similar number of businesses across Southeast Asia, including notable names such as Chope Group (Singapore), Park Hotel Group (Singapore), Rainmaker Labs (Singapore), Yesboss (Indonesia), and Malaysian Airlines (Malaysia).

item.title: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 now accepts e-signatures
item.description: Source: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 website. The Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 has introduced a paperless check-in experience featuring electronic signatures. This system aims to eliminate the need for printed documents and expedite the arrival process for guests. Aloft Bangkok claims to be the first hotel within the Starwood brand to offer this service. This innovative approach streamlines the check-in procedure by presenting all reservation details on a tablet.

item.title: DocuWorks 9 is compatible with cloud and mobile devices
item.description: Fuji Xerox Asia Pacific has introduced DocuWorks 9, a document management software now enhanced with cloud integration for seamless mobile workflows. DocuWorks allows users to interact with electronic documents, such as office files and images, as if they were physical copies. The latest mobile features empower users to pick up their work anytime, anywhere. A new feature called Task Space lets users gather work-related documents and sync them to Fuji Xerox’s cloud-based Working Folder with a simple click.

item.title: TeamAhoy introduces a new project management software that focuses on people
item.description: Source: TeamAhoy. Bramanis. TeamAhoy (previously known as Birds Eye View), an Australian company, has introduced the first public version of its project management software. The startup highlights that its software differentiates itself by prioritizing the human element, unlike competitors. Founder Damian Bramanis explains that while teams consist of people, most project management tools don’t reflect this in their design. He believes TeamAhoy stands out by offering managers a user-friendly platform that centers around individuals.
